Class SparseArray<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • SparseArray<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Array<T>

    public class SparseArray<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Array<T>
    This Class implements the Array Interface. It implements a SparseArray, which is a linked list of Node objects that contain the data of interest at a specific index. The nodes are only created if the set function is called on them. They ARE NOT deallocated if the set function sets it data back to the default value because having

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SparseArray(int length, T t)
      Constructor checks if the length is greater than 0, and stores the length and t parameters in the Objects len and def_value data members respectively

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      T get(int index)
      Get returns the value of the data member of a node for the index of interest, if the Node has never been allocated, it returns the SparseArray's def_value
      int length()
      Returns the length of the SparseArray
      void set(int index, T t)
      Set changes the data value for the node with the passed index.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • set

        public void set(int index,
       T t)
         throws IndexException
        Set changes the data value for the node with the passed index. If the Node did not exist create it if the value is different from def_value
        Specified by:
        set in interface Array<T>
        Parameters:
